senses.de: To take away a number or amount from another number or amount.
senses.ex: If you subtract 2 from 5, you get 3.

Tips.title: Math Operations
Tips.description: Used mainly for describing actions in basic math calculations.
Tips.example: Children learn how to subtract numbers in elementary school.

Tips.title: Beyond Numbers
Tips.description: Can describe reducing anything in quantity, not just numerical values.
Tips.example: If you subtract three apples from the basket, how many are left?

Tips.title: Negative Result
Tips.description: Subtracting a larger number from a smaller one gives a negative result.
Tips.example: Subtract 5 from 3, and you end up with negative two.

senses.de: To remove or take away something from an original total or group, often to make it smaller or less.
senses.ex: You have to subtract the cost of production from the sales revenue to calculate the profit.

Tips.title: Financial Context
Tips.description: Often used in finance to explain calculating profits by removing costs.
Tips.example: To find net profit, subtract expenses from the gross income.

Tips.title: Reducing Sizes
Tips.description: Applies to physically removing parts from a whole, resulting in a smaller size.
Tips.example: Subtract unwanted elements from the design to make it cleaner.

Tips.title: Abstract Concepts
Tips.description: Can be used metaphorically to describe removing non-physical items, like rights or privileges.
Tips.example: The new policy will subtract certain freedoms from the citizens.

Cut down.wordDefinition:
Cut down implies reducing the quantity of something physical, such as a tree or a list of items.

It is usually used in a physical context. For example, "The construction crew cut down the trees in the park to make space for the new building.".

Decrease.wordDefinition:
Decrease means to make something smaller or reduce its amount. It is applicable to any quantity or value that needs to be reduced.

For example, a company may decrease its expenses or a person may decrease their sugar intake.

Decrease is used to make something smaller in general, while subtract is specifically used in mathematical calculations to find the difference between two values.

Deduct.wordDefinition: Both deduct and subtract refer to the act of taking away one quantity from another. The difference is that deduct is usually used in the context of removing an amount from a total or a sum, such as when calculating taxes or discounts.

Diminish.wordDefinition:
Diminish means to make something smaller or reduce its size, amount, or intensity. For example, if you have a full glass of water and you drink some, the amount of water in the glass diminishes.

Subtract is used when you take away a specific quantity from a total, while diminish describes a reduction or decrease in something's size, amount, or intensity.

Minus.wordDefinition: Both ‘minus’ and ‘subtract’ mean to take away, but they are used in different ways. ‘Minus’ is typically used when you are talking about numbers and their values, for example: 6 minus 2 equals 4.

Reduce.wordDefinition:
Reduce usually means making something smaller, while subtract means taking something away from a larger amount.

For example, if you reduce the size of a balloon, you make it smaller. If you subtract 2 from 5, you take away two and are left with 3.

Reduce is usually used when talking about size or amount, while subtract is typically used in math when solving equations.

Take away.wordDefinition:
Subtract and take away are both mathematical terms used to describe the process of finding the difference between two numbers.

Take away is a more casual term and is often used in everyday language. It usually implies the physical act of removing something.

For example, "I'm going to take away the toys from the children."

In summary, both terms describe the same process of finding the difference between two numbers, but subtract is a more formal term used in mathematics, while take away is a more casual term used in everyday language.

Withdraw.wordDefinition:
Withdraw means to take something back or remove it.

It is usually used in a non-mathematical sense. For example, if you deposited money in a bank and then you decide to take it out, you are withdrawing the money from the bank.

Subtract is used in mathematical contexts when taking away an amount, while withdraw is used when taking something back or removing it in non-mathematical contexts.

quotes.Text: I love the beautiful distractions of the world - television and movies, video games, the Internet in general. But I try really hard to avoid them, because they don't help me become a better writer. They subtract hours from my day. And a writer's main currency is time. Time to daydream, time to walk and think, time to sit and do the work.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Nick Petrie

quotes.Text: When I - when I was going to school, I knew how to read, write, add and subtract and I - I basically said, 'What else do I need? I'm never going to be able to go to college. I'm not going to be able to afford to go to college. I'm not going to be able to get a scholarship.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Mark Wahlberg

quotes.Text: These are big trade-offs for a simple piece of cake - add five hundred calories, subtract well-being, allure, and self-esteem - and the feelings behind them are anything but vain or shallow.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Caroline Knapp

quotes.Text: Authority is something from which we are constantly subtracting, of which there remains always a residue, and which we attempt to make smaller and smaller.
quotes.Title: Spanish Activist
quotes.Name: Federica Montseny

quotes.Text: Your net worth to the world is usually determined by what remains after your bad habits are subtracted from your good ones.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.Text: A character takes shape in the act of writing. You start with something, and you add or subtract.
quotes.Title: Indian Writer
quotes.Name: Amitava Kumar

quotes.Text: Any ground subtracts its own hue from the colors which it carries and therefore influences.
quotes.Title: German Artist
quotes.Name: Josef Albers

quotes.Text: You subtract Christianity from Huston Smith, and there is no Huston Smith left.
quotes.Title: American Theologian
quotes.Name: Huston Smith

quotes.Text: Everything you add to the truth subtracts from the truth.
quotes.Title: Russian Author
quotes.Name: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quotes.Text: A short cut to riches is to subtract from our desires.
quotes.Title: Italian Poet
quotes.Name: Petrarch
